intro: Tofieldia capitata, commonly known as the marsh lily, is a flowering plant native to wetland and marsh habitats in North America. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces tall, slender flowering stems that bear clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. Its leaves are linear and grass-like, and it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Tofieldia capitata plays an important ecological role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and wildlife.
